pageContext.claim: “Remember not so long ago, Mr. President, that was the richest country in South America by a lot.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a stretch. In the late 1960s, Venezuela’s gross domestic product per capita was comparable with high income countries, and in the 1970s, it was among the richest countries in Latin America.But the World Bank always considered it a middle-income country, not in the ranks of the richest nations on earth.
